tp:treatment-sec.p:
Remarks: For description see Uvarov (1934) and data presented in this study. U. iraka and U. bakhtiara are two most similar species in the
Satunini Group
. These two species are similar, also can be distinguished from other two species in the group, by asymmetrical apical arms of titillators, relatively stronger tooth of male cerci, and large and furrowed/modified female subgenital plate. The medial transverse sulcus of female subgenital plate and tooth of male cercus located distad of the middle are two main characters distinguishing this species from U. bakhtiara . For further evaluations see Discussion below.
